-/
theorem putnam_1996_b4
(matsin : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ → Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ)
(mat1996 : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ)
(hmatsin : ∀ A, matsin A = ∑' n : ℕ, ((-(1 : ℝ)) ^ n / (2 * n + 1)!) • A ^ (2 * n + 1))
(hmat1996 : mat1996 0 0 = 1 ∧ mat1996 0 1 = 1996 ∧ mat1996 1 0 = 0 ∧ mat1996 1 1 = 1)
: (∃ A, matsin A = mat1996) ↔ putnam_1996_b4_solution :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1996_b4
(matsin : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ → Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ)
(mat1996 : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ)
(hmatsin : ∀ A, matsin A = ∑' n : ℕ, ((-(1 : ℝ)) ^ n / (2 * n + 1)!) • A ^ (2 * n + 1))
(hmat1996 : mat1996 0 0 = 1 ∧ mat1996 0 1 = 1996 ∧ mat1996 1 0 = 0 ∧ mat1996 1 1 = 1)
: (∃ A, matsin A = mat1996) ↔ putnam_1996_b4_solution := by
  have h1 : putnam_1996_b4_solution ↔ False := by
    -- We will show that no such matrix A exists.
    constructor
    · intro h
      -- Assume for contradiction that such a matrix A exists.
      rcases h with ⟨A, hA⟩
      have hA' := congr_fun (congr_fun hA 0) 0
      have hA'' := congr_fun (congr_fun hA 0) 1
      have hA''' := congr_fun (congr_fun hA 1) 0
      have hA'''' := congr_fun (congr_fun hA 1) 1
      simp [hmatsin, Matrix.one_apply, Matrix.zero_apply, Fin.sum_univ_succ, Fin.sum_univ_zero] at hA' hA'' hA''' hA''''
      <;> norm_num at hA' hA'' hA''' hA''''
      <;> nlinarith [Real.pi_pos]
    · intro h
      -- This case is impossible because we have a contradiction.
      simp_all
  simp_all
```
